wikipedia_page.main: Alice Gardner (26 April 1854 – 11 November 1927) was an English historian. Her publications included a history of Newnham College, Cambridge.

response: Gardner was married to Agnes Reid until their marriage broke down in 1874. His sister Alice Gardner was a historian and her brother, Ernest Arthur Gardner, was also an archaeologist.
His sister Alice Gardner was a historian and his brother, Percy Gardner, was also an archaeologist.

Creighton lectured twice a week at the university, preparing extensively, but lecturing extemporaneously.  He also preached in the Emmanuel College Chapel.  A colleague said of his preaching style, "He did not care for eloquence, indeed he despised it; what he aimed at was instruction, and for this he always looked more to principles than facts."  Creighton lectured more informally to undergraduates at Emmanuel College once a week.  He supported Cambridge's two new women's colleges, Newnham and Girton, and taught informal weekly classes at Newnham.  Two students from those classes, Mary Bateson and Alice Gardner, later became professional historians; both were mentored by Creighton early in their careers.

Her aunt Alice Gardner was a historian (of Newnham College) and her uncle, Percy Gardner, was also an archaeologist.Gillian Sutherland, ‘Gardner, Alice (1854–1927)’, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004 accessed 21 Feb 2017
*Julian, philosopher and emperor, and the last struggle of paganism against Christianity by Alice Gardner	13
